body_html:
I'm also seeing this issue for 40 ps 400 workers with the same call stack mentioned by @fesun. Following the call stack:

tensorflow/tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/grpc_worker_cache.cc

Line 47 in cddf8d8

callback_tag->OnCompleted(ok);

tensorflow/tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/grpc_remote_worker.cc

Line 278 in cddf8d8

delete this;

Eventually it ends up in GRPC code cc_destroy_call_elem
Either GRPC has issue destroying call element properly or TensorFlow 1.4.0 does not use GRPC properly (in particular not handling GRPC error/exception properly in this case)

Eventually it ends up in GRPC code cc_destroy_call_elem

body:
I'm also seeing this issue for 40 ps 400 workers with the same call stack mentioned by @fesun. Following the call stack:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/cddf8d82dec9fff526f5c064add725b7f35f95fa/tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/grpc_worker_cache.cc#L47
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/cddf8d82dec9fff526f5c064add725b7f35f95fa/tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/rpc/grpc_remote_worker.cc#L278

Eventually it ends up in GRPC code [cc_destroy_call_elem](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/31e99d0788f99189008f854265b1582a6ae888c5/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/client_channel.cc#L1444)
Either GRPC has issue destroying call element properly or TensorFlow 1.4.0 does not use GRPC properly (in particular not handling GRPC error/exception properly in this case)
